public class HealthTracker { private int steps; private int calorieIntake; private double weight; public HealthTracker(int initialSteps, int initialCalories, double initialWeight) { this.steps = initialSteps; this.calorieIntake = initialCalories; this.weight = initialWeight; } public void updateSteps(int newSteps) { this.steps += newSteps; if (newSteps > 10000) { this.weight -= 0.1; } } public void eatMeal(int calories) { this.calorieIntake += calories; if (calories > 700) { this.weight += 0.2; } } public double getWeight() { return this.weight; } }",

If the user modifies their meal to consume fewer than 700 calories per meal, will this have a direct effect on their weight?
Question Type: from cause to effect with intervention
Explanation: The code specifies a weight increase only if the calorie intake per meal exceeds 700 calories. Therefore, consuming fewer than 700 calories doesn't directly decrease the weight, but rather, prevents the incremental weight increase that happens with high-calorie meals.

Given this information, if the user modifies their meal to consume fewer than 700 calories per meal, there will be no direct effect on their weight according to the current implementation of the `HealthTracker` class.
